intro: Ossaea kleinii, commonly known as the Klein's ice plant, is a succulent species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the cooler months. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, storing water to help it survive in dry conditions. Ossaea kleinii is often found growing in rocky soils and is well-suited for rock gardens or xeriscaping.
